[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Side-Channel] [Memory Access Patterns] Can memory access patterns during hash_to_curve leak information about the random seed through memory bus monitoring? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Side-Channel] [Power Analysis] Could power consumption analysis during scalar/point generation reveal cryptographic secrets on validators with physical access? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Protocol] [BLS Signature Malleability] Could predictable randomness in BLS signatures enable signature malleability attacks that cause transaction replay? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Protocol] [Aggregate Signature Security] Does sequential generation of multiple G1/G2 points compromise the security of BLS signature aggregation in consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Protocol] [Rogue Key Attack] Can adversaries exploit point generation functions to construct rogue public keys that break aggregate signature security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Protocol] [Subgroup Membership] Are there explicit subgroup membership checks, or could small subgroup attacks compromise pairing-based protocols? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Protocol] [Twist Attack] For G2 points on BLS12-381, are twist security properties maintained, or could twist attacks break signature verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Concurrency] [Shared RNG State] If multiple threads share the same RNG instance without synchronization, could race conditions generate duplicate keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Concurrency] [Async Safety] Are these functions safe to call from async contexts, or could tokio/async-std runtime issues corrupt RNG state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Concurrency] [Re-entrancy] If signal handlers or interrupts occur during key generation, could re-entrant calls corrupt cryptographic state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Concurrency] [Lock-Free Algorithms] Do any lock-free data structures in underlying libraries introduce race conditions in point generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/random.rs] [Error Handling] [Unwrap Panics] The .unwrap() on line 61 - in production, should this return Result instead to handle errors gracefully? (Medium)
